name: AVError.Code
desc: The enumerated error codes for framework operations.

items.name: case airPlayControllerRequiresInternet
items.desc: The AirPlay controller requires an internet connection to function.

items.name: case airPlayReceiverRequiresInternet
items.desc: The AirPlay receiver requires an internet connection to function.

items.name: case applicationIsNotAuthorized
items.desc: The app isn’t authorized to play media.

items.name: case applicationIsNotAuthorizedToUseDevice
items.desc: The user denied this app permission to capture media.

items.name: case compositionTrackSegmentsNotContiguous
items.desc: The composition can’t add the source media because it contains gaps.

items.name: case contentIsNotAuthorized
items.desc: The user isn’t authorized to play the media.

items.name: case contentIsProtected
items.desc: The app isn’t authorized to open the media.

items.name: case contentIsUnavailable
items.desc: The captured content is unavailable.

items.name: case contentKeyRequestCancelled
items.desc: The app canceled a request to retrieve a content key.

items.name: case contentNotUpdated
items.desc: The system couldn’t update the captured content.

items.name: case createContentKeyRequestFailed
items.desc: The app couldn’t create a content key request.

items.name: case decodeFailed
items.desc: The system failed to decode the media.

items.name: case decoderNotFound
items.desc: The system can’t find a suitable decoder for the media.

items.name: case decoderTemporarilyUnavailable
items.desc: A suitable decoder for the media is temporarily available.

items.name: case deviceAlreadyUsedByAnotherSession
items.desc: Your app can’t access the device because another session is currently using it.

items.name: case deviceInUseByAnotherApplication
items.desc: Your app can’t access the device because another app is currently using it.

items.name: case deviceLockedForConfigurationByAnotherProcess
items.desc: Your app can’t change device settings because another process currently controls the device.

items.name: case deviceNotConnected
items.desc: You app can’t access the device because it isn’t connected.

items.name: case deviceWasDisconnected
items.desc: A previously connected device is no longer accessible.

items.name: case diskFull
items.desc: Recording stopped because the disk is full.

items.name: case displayWasDisabled
items.desc: Screen capture failed because the display was inactive.

items.name: case encoderNotFound
items.desc: The requested encoder isn’t found.

items.name: case encoderTemporarilyUnavailable
items.desc: An appropriate encoder isn’t currently available.

items.name: case exportFailed
items.desc: The requested export operation failed.

items.name: case externalPlaybackNotSupportedForAsset
items.desc: The current asset doesn’t support playback.

items.name: case failedToLoadMediaData
items.desc: The system can’t load the requested media data.

items.name: case failedToParse
items.desc: The system can’t parse the media.

items.name: case fileAlreadyExists
items.desc: A file with the same name exists at the location and you can’t overwrite it.

items.name: case fileFailedToParse
items.desc: The file is corrupt or in an unrecognized format.

items.name: case fileFormatNotRecognized
items.desc: The system can’t open the file because it’s in an unrecognized format.

items.name: case fileTypeDoesNotSupportSampleReferences
items.desc: The file type doesn’t support sample references.

items.name: case formatUnsupported
items.desc: The current asset format isn’t supported.

items.name: case incompatibleAsset
items.desc: You can’t display the media because the device isn’t capable of playing the content.

items.name: case incorrectlyConfigured
items.desc: The system is incorrectly configured for the requested operation.

items.name: case invalidCompositionTrackSegmentDuration
items.desc: You can’t add the source media because its duration in the destination is invalid.

items.name: case invalidCompositionTrackSegmentSourceDuration
items.desc: You can’t add the source media because it has no duration.

items.name: case invalidCompositionTrackSegmentSourceStartTime
items.desc: You can’t add the source media because its start time in the destination is invalid.

items.name: case invalidOutputURLPathExtension
items.desc: The path extension of the output URL is invalid.

items.name: case invalidSourceMedia
items.desc: The system couldn’t read the source media.

items.name: case invalidVideoComposition
items.desc: You attempted to present an unsupported video composition.

items.name: case malformedDepth
items.desc: The depth data isn’t properly structured.

items.name: case maximumDurationReached
items.desc: The recording stopped because it reached the file’s maximum duration.

items.name: case maximumFileSizeReached
items.desc: The recording stopped because it reached the file’s maximum size.

items.name: case maximumNumberOfSamplesForFileFormatReached
items.desc: The recording stopped because it reached the file’s maximum number of samples.

items.name: case maximumStillImageCaptureRequestsExceeded
items.desc: Your app can’t take a photo because there are too many unfinished photo capture requests.

items.name: case mediaChanged
items.desc: Recording stopped because the format of the source media changed.

items.name: case mediaDiscontinuity
items.desc: Recording stopped because there was an interruption in the input media.

items.name: case mediaServicesWereReset
items.desc: The system couldn’t perform the operation because media services were unavailable.

items.name: case noCompatibleAlternatesForExternalDisplay
items.desc: The system found no compatible external displays.

items.name: case noDataCaptured
items.desc: The recording failed because the system received no data.

items.name: case noImageAtTime
items.desc: No image is available in the media at the indicated time.

items.name: case noLongerPlayable
items.desc: The asset is no longer playable.

items.name: case noSourceTrack
items.desc: The asset doesn’t contain a source track.

items.name: case operationCancelled
items.desc: The asset handled a request to cancel loading a property value asynchronously.

items.name: case operationInterrupted
items.desc: An interruption occurred while performing a reading or writing operation.

items.name: case operationNotAllowed
items.desc: The requested operation isn’t allowed.

items.name: case operationNotSupportedForAsset
items.desc: Your app attempted to perform an unsupported operation with the asset.

items.name: case operationNotSupportedForPreset
items.desc: Your app attempted to perform an unsupported operation for the current preset.

items.name: case outOfMemory
items.desc: The operation couldn’t finish because there isn’t enough memory available to process the media.

items.name: case recordingAlreadyInProgress
items.desc: Your app attempted to start recording a movie file while an existing recording is underway.

items.name: case referenceForbiddenByReferencePolicy
items.desc: The current reference restrictions prevent the system from loading referenced media.

items.name: case rosettaNotInstalled
items.desc: The system doesn’t have Rosetta installed and can’t perform the requested operation.

items.name: case screenCaptureFailed
items.desc: An unexpected problem occurred that prevented screen capture.

items.name: case segmentStartedWithNonSyncSample
items.desc: The operation attempted to write a new MPEG-4 segment that didn’t start with a sync sample.

items.name: case serverIncorrectlyConfigured
items.desc: The configuration of the HTTP server that streams the media resource isn’t correct.

items.name: case sessionConfigurationChanged
items.desc: Recording stopped because the configuration of media sources and destinations changed.

items.name: case sessionHardwareCostOverage
items.desc: Your app requested too many camera hardware resources.

items.name: case sessionNotRunning
items.desc: The recording couldn’t start because the session isn’t running.

items.name: case sessionWasInterrupted
items.desc: The recording stopped because the system interrupted the audio session.

items.name: case torchLevelUnavailable
items.desc: The specified torch level is valid but currently unavailable, possibly due to overheating.

items.name: case undecodableMediaData
items.desc: The system couldn’t decode the media data.

items.name: case unknown
items.desc: An unknown error occurred.

items.name: case unsupportedDeviceActiveFormat
items.desc: The capture session doesn’t support the camera device’s active format.

items.name: case unsupportedOutputSettings
items.desc: Your app requested unsupported output settings.

items.name: case videoCompositorFailed
items.desc: The compositor couldn’t composite video frames.
